attributes.action: Stop the Experimental Closures on the byways & Droves near Stonehenge
attributes.background:
The public have had access from the A303 & Larkhill to park up and walk around the landscape of our acient Stonehenge free of charge, 24/7. It's the only safe place to visitors can stay free.
We object the refusal of motorized vehicals on the byways that have been used freely for various reasons.
attributes.additional_details:
English Heritage do not provide free 24/7 parking near Stonehenge to view on the free permissive path. 
The reasons for Closure need to be further debated with the public involved who wish to use the byways as usual. 
The report on objections made by the public are going into a report that is not independent from the Government officials and highways

attributes.action: Allow tax payers to opt out of funding war and fund conflict prevention instead
attributes.background: All UK taxpayers, including corporation tax payers, should have the opportunity to express their conscientious objection to their taxes being used on military and weapons. Instead the amount of their tax which would have been spent on military and weapons should fund conflict prevention programmes.

attributes.action: Stop Network Rail's programme to fell millions of trees
attributes.background: Network Rail recently began cutting down trees on a massive scale. We call on the government to halt this tree felling programme until a comprehensive public consultation has been conducted, to include relevant wildlife and environmental bodies such as The Wildlife Trust, RSPB, The Tree Council, etc
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/business/2018/apr/29/millions-of-trees-at-risk-in-secretive-network-rail-felling-programme

attributes.action: Increase funding for Bedfordshire Police to combat the rise in serious crime.
attributes.background: Bedfordshire is classified as a rural Police force, yet it has every major crime that larger cities such as Manchester, Birmingham and London have. Luton alone has an International Airport, Gun, Gang and knife crime, terrorism and hate crime, as well as a massive problem with anti social behaviour.
attributes.additional_details:
Our Officers in Luton are inundated with exceptional volumes of calls, to a point where they are unable to attend crimes in progress due to a lack of resources.
This has happened numerous times In the past 6 months, to a point where local residents do not report crime because they know Police will not attend.
Our own local Policing Team should have up to 10 officers, but due to cutbacks and lack of funding we are now down to 3, which is a reduction of 70%, and this is echoed across the county

attributes.action: Ban the use and production of micro-plastic glitter!
attributes.background:
Micro-plastic glitters are used in everyday items; posing an ecological hazard to our oceans and aquatic life.
There is a ban on micro-beads and we call for this ban to be extended to micro-plastic glitter.
attributes.additional_details:
Micro-plastic glitter passes through waterways into the ocean, marine life and birds mistake it for food; glitters are produced with toxic additives; which is then consumed by us. It has been reported that plastic was found in a third of UK-caught fish. With approx. 51 million fragments in the ocean.

These micro-plastic glitter can break down to release chemicals that disrupt hormones in the bodies of both animals and humans
We hold a responsibility to future generations to stop this pollution.

attributes.action: Introduce a health and safety law on the maximum temperature in a workplace
attributes.background: With the current heatwave in the UK employees all over the country are suffering and struggling to continue working. Many institutions lack working air conditioning systems and without a law on the maximum temperatures within workplaces, employers are doing very little to aid the welfare of staff.
attributes.additional_details: In some fast food restaurants, kitchens are reaching highs of 36 degrees Celsius. Staff working in kitchens of all kinds are surrounded by grills, oil fryers, and heated surfaces, and cannot drink within their station for fear of cross contamination. All of these factors combine to make workplaces unbearable, and especially those working around food who sweat profusely in these conditions, it is not just them but the consumers at risk.

attributes.action: Raise the profile of menopause in the public domain
attributes.background: Menopause affects half the population at some point in their lives, but menopause is often not acknowledged, taken seriously or knowledgably by Health Care Professionals. As many women are now employed and work for longer, greater awareness is needed to be more healthy and productive for longer.
attributes.additional_details: Provide more awareness and clarity on menopause through leaflets at Health Care Providers, emphasising that it's not just hot flushes that signal menopause. Target women in their 40s, 50s and 60s to cover all stages of menopause. Many women on contraceptives such as the mini-pill or the coil do not menstruate so need guidance. Integrate the information into the NHS website so that if you search for subjects such as memory loss, tiredness, anxiety etc. it states menopause as a possible cause.

attributes.action: Ban the shooting of Pheasants, Partridges and Grouse for sport.
attributes.background: 35 Million "game birds" are placed into the countryside annually for shooting, disrupting the environmental balance.  Native wildlife is killed to increase the number of game birds available for shooting. Damage to the environment and suffering to native species and to the game birds is unacceptable
attributes.additional_details: The the introduction of a tens millions of non-native birds upsets the environmental balance of our countryside increasing competition, especially for food amongst native birds. Wildlife such as foxes, crows, magpies, badgers and weasels are directly or indirectly affected by shooting, snaring, trapping and illegal poisoning carried out by gamekeepers. Additionally, the loss of predator species does in itself further disrupt the local wildlife balance as species such as rodents can then thrive.

attributes.action: Set up a public inquiry into Greater Manchester Police.
attributes.background: GMP has been the subject of negative media reports. Complaints have been to the Independent Office for Police Conduct & the Mayor, but there are still problems.
attributes.additional_details: Police forces shouldn’t be able to investigate themselves as GMP has done. That is a failing in the police complaints system, resulting in a lack of accountability for senior police officers. GMP also has primacy over the North-West Counter Terrorism Unit. Any problems in GMP could risk being transferred to the NWCTU, which could potentially have a national impact. We need a public inquiry now.

attributes.action: Ask UN to take Jerusalem under its protection.
attributes.background: US recognition of Jerusalem as Israel's capital has emboldened Israel to carry on denying that East Jerusalem is occupied. The only fair solution is to return to the 1947 Partition Plan and make Jerusalem a corpus separatum.

attributes.action: Change the colour of becons to red when stationery for recovery vehicles
attributes.background: Unfortunately the use of amber becons do not work any more everything these days seems to have amber lights the recovery industry have lost a lot of people lately doing our job at road side
attributes.additional_details: The construction industry have got green becons when working it makes them stands out we would stand out with red becons and it could save our lives

attributes.action: Ban any planning/ development on green belt, even in 'exceptional circumstances'
attributes.background: Successive Gts have failed to plan for UK future housing need. Local (housing) plans require local authorities to plan for future housing plans in that area. Authorities are offered huge financial incentives. Gmt targets are unrealistic and 220,000+ homes are currently planned for the green belt.
attributes.additional_details:
12.4% of UK is GB.
Landowners offered ££ to sell. 
Gmt housing targets fantasy, touting need for 'affordable housing', (80% of current market rent). LA's offered ££ to overbuild through 'new'/ 'affordable' homes bonuses. 
30m people live around GB. 30,000km of public rights of way. 250kha quality agricultural land. 89000ha SSSI.
220000ha mixed woodland. 
We say:
Review new homes targets. 
Brownfield not green belt.
No new homes bonuses.
Cease all current/ future plans to develop the green belt.

attributes.action: Support the curry industry by reviewing immigration policy
attributes.background: The British curry industry is suffering since the government's cap on skilled workers was introduced over 10 years ago. We urge the government to review and reverse this policy as this cap is creating a vacuum in the area of skilled chefs, damaging growth and sustainability of the industry.
attributes.additional_details:
Previous attempts by this and former governments to train chefs within specialized Training Centres of Excellence in the UK have consistently failed to produce the skilled chefs required to address the shortage. Closures of restaurants around the country are at an alarming rate of 3-4 per week. Heavy handed raids by UKBA and heavily imposed penalties add to the burden levied upon the restaurateurs eager to maintain and survive the current economic climate.
For further info visit www.bca1960.com”
attributes.creator_name: Mohammed Mustafa Kamal Yakub, on behalf of the Bangladesh Caterers Association

attributes.action: Make it illegal for schools to have compulsory logo trousers, skirts or shirts
attributes.background: Many schools and academies are adding expensive logo trousers, skirts and shirts to their uniforms, for example increasing the cost of school trousers from £4.50 to £19.95. Often the opinions of parents are ignored, and families have to pay these large bills or face having their children excluded.
attributes.additional_details: If you wish to see evidence of this, look at the cost of uniform providers such as Just Schoolwear or Schoolwear Solutions for logo items. Then compare to a high street retailer such as George, Tesco or Sainsbury.

attributes.action: Ban average speed cameras due to them being a distraction for drivers.
attributes.background: Highways England have declared that an incredibly realistic looking 'dummy' average speed camera is distracting and therefore is unsafe for the public, and have requested Bedfordshire county council have the camera removed.
attributes.additional_details:
By stating this, it stands to reason all average speed cameras are unsafe
 
Given the similarities between the dummy camera and normal average speed cameras, I believe Highways England have effectively stated all average speed cameras are distracting. 

The government rightly outlawed the use of mobile phones behind the wheel because they are distracting. It is therefore reasonable for all average speed cameras to be banned.

attributes.action: Change the law on smashing a car window to release a dog from a hot car.
attributes.background: At present, members of the public risk being prosecuted for criminal damage if they act on instinct and smash the window of a vehicle to release a distressed dog which is trapped inside the vehicle in hot weather. The burden of proof is upon them to show that smashing the window was necessary.
attributes.additional_details: Please change the law to allow for concerned members of the public to release animals (dogs) trapped inside vehicles by smashing a window in circumstances where it would be deemed reasonable to assume that the animal (dog) is suffering from heat stroke or is at imminent risk of suffering heatstroke. Place the burden of proof on the owner to demonstrate that the animal (dog) was not at risk.

attributes.action: Appoint a select committee to examine the cost of medication supplied to the NHS
attributes.background: A recent report in the UK press alleged that some suppliers were overcharging the NHS for medication.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament should form a select committee to examine this allegation and suggest practical ways the government can prevent the NHS from being abused in this way.

attributes.action: Start the Gender Reform Act reformation process
attributes.background: The Government announced a consultation in 2016 to reform the Gender Recognition Act. This has been delayed for no explained reason, which has resulted in confusion, fear and misinformation, it’s delayed equality measures for our Trans and non-binary residents.
attributes.additional_details:
The Gender Recognition Act is in urgent need of reform if Her Majesty’s Government is to bring about full legal dignity for its trans and non-binary citizens. When the Women and Equalities Committee set out its recommendations for trans equality in 2016, it called to "update the GRA in line with principles of gender self-declaration [through statutory declaration] that have been developed in other jurisdictions", in turn removing the
medicalised, quasi-judicial process for gender recognition.

attributes.action: Provide separate labour wards for women giving birth to stillborn babies.
attributes.background: I gave birth to my dead baby boy on a maternity ward 17 years ago surrounded by crying babies. It was soul destroying knowing others were celebrating new life, when a life had been taken from me. Future mothers should never experience this tragedy and is why I am calling for legislative change.
attributes.additional_details:
According to stillbirth charity 'Tommy's Organisation', one in every 225 births ends in stillbirth in the UK - making that nine babies every day. It's also estimated that 4.2 million are living with depression associated with previous stillbirth - a number which cannot go ignored.

It's imperative to change the future of these bereaved mothers by creating the best environment possible for one to give birth to a dead child, and to ensure we provide the tools to be able to cope with such a loss.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to introduce car parking charges for common land car parks
attributes.background: With an increasing obese population charging to park by common land discourages the access to outdoor activities and discriminates the poorer. The maintenance of car parks in common land car parks should be covered by existing local taxes as it is for parks and children’s playgrounds .

attributes.action: Introduce state registry system for medical cannabis cards in the UK
attributes.background: A system already stablished in several countries that allows the possession of cannabis by people suffering from a chronic or debilitating disease or condition which has been diagnosed by a licensed physician who believes the use of cannabis will benefit the patient's condition and well-being.
attributes.additional_details:
Amend current legislation and introduce a system similar to the one existing in Colorado (USA), where registered patients can obtain a valid ID which allows them to possess no more than two Oz of a usable form of the plant and to grow for personal use no more than 6 plants (maximum of 3 being mature plants) at a time.

A new report about the effects of cannabis is needed reflecting all the new evidence supporting its beneficial effects as well as solutions to the so called "harmful effects".

attributes.action: Fund the dualling of the A120 from Hare Green to Harwich
attributes.background: There is an agreement in place for the stretch of the A120 to be dualled with funding from Hutchison Ports as part of planning permission for a container port at Bathside Bay, Harwich. But this has been delayed for years and the town cannot wait any longer - the road needs to be dualled now.
attributes.additional_details: With an ever increasing population and more lorries using Harwich International Port the road is under strain. It is also in need of complete relaying as the concrete slabs it was laid on are at the end of their lifespan. The road should be dualled now rather than relaying it as a single carriageway. Better road access is hoped to bring economic growth to Tendring, which has some of the most deprived wards in the country. It is also home to a major UK port - a gateway to Europe.

attributes.action: Create new laws around letting agents to ensure students don’t get overcharged
attributes.background: Many students get overcharged when leaving their properties because it is very easy to become blinded by the confusion of the big wide world. I want laws to be changed so landlords/letting agents cannot try to charge ridiculous prices for basic things like cleaning and painting.
attributes.additional_details: I have been charged over £1000 for leaving my property after my 2nd year at University for just cleaning, gardening and painting. I have started a Facebook petition reaching out to other students and so far I have over 300 cases. I feel that it’s too easy for students to fall into these traps and accept these charges, as we do not understand the full breakdown of these costs. There needs to be a law to ban landlords and letting agents charging more than 10% mark up on services at the end of tenancies. Students are being exploited.

attributes.action: Call for James Brokenshire to revoke planning permission to mine in Pont Valley
attributes.background: The opencast site covers 71ha of wildlife habitats, including nesting curlews and crested newts. There is no protection from the dust for the local residents and school. The Banks group have repeatedly violated the terms of their planning permission, beginning work without completing an access road.
attributes.additional_details: Britain's dependency on coal has plummeted to under 7% in 2017 compared to over 40% in 2012. The amount of coal to be taken from this site is insignificant in this context and not worth the extent of the environmental degradation and damage to health it will cause. Sajid Javid recognised that Britain is moving beyond this outdated way of thinking; James Brokenshire needs to step up and stop Durham County Council from allowing this. Coal is part of County Durham's heritage but not it's future.

attributes.action: Make Alcoholic Drinks Carry A Health Warning.
attributes.background: I believe that Alcoholic Drinks should carry a Health Warning on the label, as Cigarettes do. These Health Warnings should include things such as: the possibility liver failure and other health issues that Alcohol consumption can cause, as well as carry a general warning to Not Drink and Drive.

attributes.action: Bring Oliver Robbins before the European Scrutiny Committee.
attributes.background: Mr Robbins has a key role in the negotiations for exiting the EU. He is a public servant and as such is answerable for actions that he has taken.
attributes.additional_details: In PMQs on 2nd May 2018, the Chair of the ESC asked the Prime Minister to request the presence of Ollie Robbins to answer questions for the Committee. He commented that Mr Robbins has been asked at least 3 times. It is unacceptable, when he is so involved in the negotiations, that he has shown such disregard to the Committee and the electorate.

attributes.action: Ban the use of face coverings at protests and counter protests.
attributes.background: It has became common practice for protesters to attend protests with their faces totally covered. With the sole aim of causing trouble and escaping police prosecutions. The police rely heavily on video footage to enable prosecutions at later dates and away from a hostile crowd.
attributes.additional_details:
Being able to cover ones face empowers people to commit crimes of assault, criminal damage, racial abuse, etc, that they may not otherwise commit. Much the same as a fake profile online empowers people to say things that they would be to afraid to say on a real profile. 
A law would greatly aid the police in doing their job and keeping the peace at public protests and counter protests. I feel it would reduce the number of offences committed at protests considerably.

attributes.action: Allow Bashir Ahmadzai to stay in the UK indefinitely.
attributes.background: Bashir Ahmadzai came to the UK 6 years ago to escape the Taliban. He is profoundly deaf & court documents say he has “complex speech, language & communication difficulties”.  He is an extremely vulnerable young person who is under threat of deportation. We ask that he is allowed to remain in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: For more information please read this comprehensive piece about Bashir's case by Aditya Chakrabortty which appeared in the Guardian on 26 June: https://amp.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/jun/26/trump-british-brutality-us-mexico-border

attributes.action: All UK citizens have the right to vote on referendums affecting the UK's future.
attributes.background: The recent BREXIT referendum limited the right of UK citizens to vote on the UK's future on the basis of residence. UK citizens, resident abroad, but still registered in electoral roles, were eligible. However, many others were disenfranchised and unable to vote on issues affecting their future.
attributes.additional_details: UK citizens, working and living in the EU for more than 2 years before the Brexit referendum, were arbitrarily disenfranchised  by the UK Government, and were ineligible to vote on an issue that affected their future and legal standing in the EU. Parliament must ensure that any future referendum affecting the governance of the UK must consult all UK citizens, regardless of residence. Local Consular offices charged with registering all UK citizens abroad, can verify their voting eligibility.

attributes.action: Introduce statutory LGBT+ element for Initial Teacher & School Governor Training
attributes.background: A lack of training on the prevention of LGBT+ bullying, means providers like Stonewall & www.inclusionforall.co.uk often work with schools where LGBT+ bullying is already happening. Stonewall research shows almost half of LGBT pupils are bullied at school. Teachers must be trained from the start.
attributes.additional_details: The National LGBT Survey found that a third of respondents who were in education in 2016-2017 said that they experienced a negative reaction during that time due to them being, or people perceiving them to be, LGBT. The most frequent perpetrators of the respondents’ most serious incidents were other students (in 88% of cases) but a tenth (9%) were committed by teaching staff. The resulting action plan focuses heavily on ‘tackling’ not organisational culture change in order to prevent prejudice.

attributes.action: Create a UK wide waste and recycling system.
attributes.background: The current waste and recycling system is broken down into counties or smaller regions of the country which are able to recycle different products, have different coloured signage, and for the most part a complete lack of public reycling facilities.We could be recycling more and not adding confusion
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government has said it will reduce plastic waste and increase recycling rates. This coupled with China no longer taking plastic waste means that more needs to be done to recycle items in this country. Currently councils are only able to recycle certain items meaning that a lot of recycling across the country actually ends up in landfil/waste to energy.We need one system for the whole country so that no matter where you are it is clear which bin an item should go in and it will be recycled

attributes.action: Vehicle theory test to include section on motorcycle awareness on the road
attributes.background: Please help change our vehical theory test in scotland! To include a mandatory section on how drivers and motorcycle riders can look out for each other on the road. So we can prevent a very high amount of Accidents regarding road users.
attributes.additional_details: 20% of all accidents on Scotland's non-build up roads involve motorbikes. Approximately 60% of all motorcycle fatlities in scotland occur on these carriageways. In 2017 their were 827 motorcycle accidents 34 were fatal. Not a single cause of motorbike accidents in 2017 were caused by flooded/icy road coditions. 50% of motorbike accidents in Scotland were 30mph or less! Riders are 40 times more likely to be KILLED than any other road user. We can change this! Please sign this petition.

attributes.action: Introduce Emergency Visitor Visa for families of citizens with critical illness
attributes.background: My friend was diagnosed with cancer recently. Chemo makes her so sick that she struggles to take care of her 2 year daughter. Her mother applied for UK visitor visa to come and look after her and her family. However it was rejected saying she is not a genuine visitor and will not go back to Iran.
attributes.additional_details: A new visitor visa category should be introduced  for non-British immediate family members of British citizens with life threatening illnesses such as cancer or conditions requiring full-time care. This is to assist British citizens with family living outside of the UK in receiving the mental and physical support of their families, paramount to coping with their health issues and difficulties arising from their condition.

attributes.action: Parking on pavements, verges or footpaths to be made an offence in England.
attributes.background: Vehicles parking on pavements, verges or footpaths invariably place pedestrians at risk by forcing them onto the road.
attributes.additional_details: Vehicles parking on pavements, verges or footpaths, – even on roads with no markings, invariably place pedestrians at risk by forcing them onto the road. This is further exacerbated for wheelchair users and parents using pushchairs etc. I feel that this is an increasingly common behaviour which will eventually result in an increasing death and injury toll. In this age of improving Health & Safety legislation this type of behaviour is a travesty.

attributes.action: Bring back Appeal rights & Right to work for migrants
attributes.background:
Under Immigration Act 2014, most migrants lost their right of appeal -that took their basic rights away - like Access to employment, NHS & much more. These are some of the basic needs a person requires to sustain one self. 
This has lead to many migrants living in destitute conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
In the wake of windrush incident,many of us are now awake as to what is happening in the society we live in.The whole country was left in shock. The migrants suffer everyday with these hostile policies.

We have recently seen a case of a Nigerian woman who despite facing difficulties got justice thru the courts. 

https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/aug/21/court-says-seriously-ill-woman-can-work-while-fighting-uk-deportation

Please help in bringing back basic needs for these migrants.

attributes.action: Fund more medical research into Neuroblastoma
attributes.background:
Neuroblastoma is a Cancer In Children. Mostly under fives. 
It’s the most common form of Cancer In Babies.15% deaths in children.
One in 7000 children are affected.
The treatment is very aggressive and more support for the families diagnosed with Neuroblastoma is needed now.

attributes.action: Grant immunity from prosecution for military, whilst on Govt Duty.
attributes.background: A statutory time limit of 5 years to be applied and back-dated in regards to the rights of people to bring prosecutions for alleged offences committed by members of the British Military taking part in Govt Sanctioned Operations. After this period, the military should be exempt from prosecution.

attributes.action: Provide and fund research into incurable PCOS and HS including the link between
attributes.background: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and Hidradenitis Suppurativa are common incurable illnesses that are dismissed due to the lack of understanding about why they occur and why the two are often found to occur together. The coping strategies fail many people or cause further illnesses as a result.
attributes.additional_details:
Antibiotics are often used as treatment for HS but this is not good enough when we are under threat of antibiotic resistance.
The pill is used as treatment for PCOS but doesn't seem logical when many women struggle to conceive a child anyway.
Despite being made to try a range of prescription medicines and treatments that may not help at all, we are not exempt from paying for them.

attributes.action: Impose sanctions on USA for removing children from immigrant parents at borders
attributes.background: America is currently removing children from their immigrant parents at borders, and placing them alone in detention centres. Its also come to light that they have since 'lost' track of over 1500 children.. the these children have simply disappeared.

attributes.action: An Opt Out system with the Bone Marrow Register and more awareness in Education.
attributes.background:
Every day at least 5 people start their search for a bone marrow donor. There are currently only 2% of people in the UK registered. This compares to 13% in Cyprus, 12% in Israel and 9% in Germany.
90% of donations take place via peripheral blood stem cell (PBSC) collection, similar to giving blood.
attributes.additional_details:
Organ donation is highlighted with public campaigns as is blood donation. Both saves lives. Bone Marrow Donation is not. It needs more public awareness, more understanding within the communities and schools. It must be made compulsory within the school age of 14-16 years. It can reduce concerns and highlight the simplicity of the procedure, which will potentially save someone's life ! 
There should be an 'Opt Out' system where those who wish to not donate can remove themselves from the register.

attributes.action: Remove shortage occupation codes and Teaching roles from Tier 2 Visa cap.
attributes.background: Since December 2017, points required to obtain a Restricted Certificate of Sponsorship (RCOS) has more than doubled. Originally, only 21 points was required for sponsorship. Lately, the points have been set between 46-55 points.
attributes.additional_details:
Schools in the UK are facing the worst recruitment and retainment crisis. 
Removing all teaching roles from the RCOS cap will allow foreign educators to remain in the UK, ultimately helping to ease the current issues. 
Additionally, removal of the shortage occupation codes will allow businesses to more fairly compete for international talent.
http://www.bbc.com/news/education-42873153
https://www.peoplemanagement.co.uk/news/articles/businesses-unable-recruit-overseas-visa-limit-breached

attributes.action: Pressure Kingdom of Saudi Arabia not to execute a female civil right activist.
attributes.background: Israa Al-Ghomgham is an activist who participated in and documented the mass protests that have taken place in Qatif province in Saudi Arabia since 2011. She is currently facing the death penalty and is due to be beheaded by a public prosecutor of the KSA.
attributes.additional_details:
Saudi Arabia is taking the rare step of seeking the death penalty for a 29-year-old female activist accused of encouraging demonstrations for greater rights for the Shiite Muslim minority, the advocacy group Human Rights Watch said. 
Beheading Ms Israa Ghomgham for conducting peaceful protest is a barbaric act that violates both British and Universal values of basic human rights. We demand that the British Government put maximum pressure on the KSA to stop this barbaric act.

attributes.action: Ban Releases Of Foil & Plastic Balloons, Balloons With Ribbons & Sky Lanterns
attributes.background: We are the National Association Of Balloon Artists & Suppliers (NABAS), and we are seriously concerned that the release of Foil Balloons, Plastic Balloons, Any Balloons With Ribbons Attached And Sky Lanterns represent a genuine threat to wildlife and our environment and therefore should be banned.
attributes.additional_details: There are far to many examples of the damaging effect caused by irresponsible release of foil balloons, plastic balloons and indeed any balloon with ribbons or plastic attached. Sky lanterns pose an additional risk as a fire hazard and a risk to our animals and wildlife due to the wire framed or bamboo construction, and they create a choking hazard. We respect the findings of the 2013 DEFRA report, but evidence shows a ban on such releases is needed. Our request does not include latex balloons

attributes.action: We call on Goverment to provide an extra £10M a year for Leicestershire Police.
attributes.background:
We call on the Home Secretary to provide an extra £10 million a year for overstretched Leicestershire Police.
It would provide 300 extra officers on the beat to fight increasing crime including shop lifting, burglaries & knife-crime.With fewer officers, the force is struggling to deal with crime.
attributes.additional_details:
There are more reported burglaries, instances of shoplifting, people dealing drugs and in some instances children as young as 12 are apparently selling drugs.
Unless something is done and soon, problems will only escalate. Resources are limited across the public sector but it is false economy not to deal with the situation.
People must be able to feel safe in their own homes, and city.
We are hoping that if enough people support the petition the issue will be debated in Parliament.

attributes.action: Slash Home Office settlement and naturalisation fees: stop making a huge profit
attributes.background: Home Office charges £2,389 for indefinite leave to remain (per person for the main applicant and every dependant) a rise of 25% on 2016-17. It costs £243 to process each application. The settlement visa for an adult dependent has risen from £585 in 2008-09 to £3,250 in 2017-18, an increase of 450%.
attributes.additional_details:
Fees for immigration and nationality applications have steadily risen since 2010 including in the latest round of changes in April. 
Figures released to the BBC showed the Home Office made £800m in revenue from fees in six years. 
The Home Office made profits of up to 800% on some immigration applications from families. 
References : https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/jun/24/reduce-home-office-fees-say-mps-campaigners

attributes.action: Condemn the actions of the 1970-79 Governments in taking the UK into the EEC
attributes.background: There has long been controversy as to the legality of Britain being a member of the EEC/EU. We believe that our entry into the EU was contrary to the Vienna Convention 1969 and the British Bill of Rights 1689. The Government must acknowledge this and condemn the actions of the 1970-79 Governments.
attributes.additional_details: Actions that violated the Vienna Convention could include secret negotiations, misleading the people and failing to conform with the constitution of the signature state. No Treaty is valid if people of that state are misled as to the intentions of a treaty and it is not made in "good faith". With the republication of document FCO 30/1048, we believe the 1970-79 Governments were complicit when assuring the people and UK Parliament that there was no question of surrendering national sovereignty.

attributes.action: Change CMS from GROSS pay back to NET pay and don't include a fathers overtime.
attributes.background: The child support agency (CSA) has changed over to the child maintainance service (CMS) and in doing so it has changed calculations from NET PAY to GROSS PAY costing dads anywhere from £50 extra per month to 200+ extra per month, as these new calculations also include overtime.
attributes.additional_details: Also take into account the mental state this can have on a father. We are trying to prevent problems, not create more.

attributes.action: Introduce reduced flexible working hours for breastfeeding parents
attributes.background:
There are benefits to mother and child for extended breastfeeding with the WHO recommends breastfeeding for the first 2 years of life. 
Many women find the return to work makes continuing breastfeeding difficult, other countries have support in place for this to continue.
attributes.additional_details:
Many other countries have support in place for breastfeeding to continue, eg Portugal has a 'breastfeeding license' which reduces the working day by 2 hours, this would allow a mother the optiond to arrive later, leave earlier, pop home during the day to feed or to use the time during the working day to pump to provide milk for when they are away.

Many women need to return to work and a change like this would allow them to provide financially as well as physically for their child.

attributes.action: Allow EU nationals with permanent residence to participate in a People's Vote
attributes.background:
The prospect of parliamentary deadlock has revived talk of a second referendum. 
The Brexiteers lied during the campaign and broke election law for deliberately exceeding spending limits and making false promises.
The public deserves a chance to vote on the final deal.
attributes.additional_details:
In light of this, EU residents in the UK have studied, worked, paid taxes and contributed to the British society for many years. Many have permanent residence but not yet British citizenship. They have made the UK their home and they deserve to have a say in the (possible) upcoming referendum. 
Kindly consider this petition.

attributes.action: Cancel Parliament's Summer Recess to sort out the Brexit Deal
attributes.background:
MPs have failed to agree a plan for Brexit and are clearly now struggling to fit the debate into their schedules, given that they all expect to be leaving Westminster for their Summer Holidays shortly.
We urgently need to ensure a good deal for Britain from the EU, ahead of Brexit in March 2019.
